questions.question: Janet as well as her sisters …………………… well.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: …………………… she is very rich, she is not very happy.
questions.description: As and since give the reason. Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: When we were kids, we …………………….. go swimming every weekend.
questions.description: Both would and used to can be used to talk about past habits.

questions.question: The sun as well as the moon …………………….. light.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: She screamed ……………………… she was in pain.
questions.description: As if and as though are used to say what a situation seems like.

questions.question: …………………… he was very arrogant, no one liked him.
questions.description: As shows the reason.

questions.question: He is ………………………. to buy a yacht.
questions.description: When enough is an adverb, it goes after the adjective or adverb modified by it.

questions.question: He was ……………………. tired to walk.
questions.description: Note the pattern too..to..

questions.question: It is time you ……………………… another place to live in.
questions.description: A past tense is used after it is time...

questions.question: The house was ……………………. beautiful that he decided to buy it.
questions.description: Note the conjunction so...that...

questions.question: If you had been careful, the accident …………………………
questions.description: In the third conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: If you are free in the afternoon, we ………………………. to the movies.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will/can/may + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: There was ………………………… anything in the box.
questions.description: Hardly means scarcely.

questions.question: There lay ……………………………… books on the table.
questions.description: A few indicates a small number few means almost none.

questions.question: ………………………………. the thunderstorm approaching, we rushed indoors.
……………………………. on tip-toe, he reached for the apple.
Would you mind ……………………………. the door?
questions.description: An ing form is used after would you mind.

questions.question: You ……………………………… attend the meeting.
questions.description: The modal auxiliary need is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You had better ………………………….. a doctor.
questions.description: The bare infinitive is used after had better.

questions.question: You don’t need …………………………….. all questions.
questions.description: When need is an ordinary verb, it is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: Beethoven is ……………………………… than most other composers.
I prefer watching TV …………………………… reading books.
questions.description: Prefer is followed by the preposition to.

questions.question: He is ………………………………. of my four children.
The older we grow, ………………………………. we become.
questions.description: The + comparative is used in both clauses in this structure.

questions.question: I have lived in cities so I …………………………….. the noise.
It wasn’t easy for me to get ……………………………… up in the middle of the night.
questions.description: An ing form or a noun is used after get used to or be used to.

questions.question: He …………………………… smoke, but now he doesn’t.
questions.description: We use used to to talk about past habits.

questions.question: I …………………………………. living alone.
When I was a child, I …………………………….. watch a lot of movies.
questions.description: Used to shows past habits.

questions.question: He ……………………………. he was feeling better.
questions.description: That can be dropped after said.

questions.question: I ………………………………… she was lying.
questions.description: That can be dropped after think.

questions.question: He ………………………………. I should wait a little longer.
questions.description: That can be dropped after suggest.

questions.question: He …………………………………. he was not coming.
questions.description: That cannot be dropped after reply.

questions.question: She………………………………. she was busy.
questions.description: That cannot be dropped after shout.

questions.question: No one paid attention to the ……………………………………. the child felt lonely at home.
You can borrow my car ……………………………. you bring it back tomorrow.
I prefer riding my bicycle ………………………. driving the car.
She enjoys ……………………………. time in her garden.
questions.description: Enjoy should be followed by an ing form, not an infinitive.

questions.question: I am not used to …………………………… alone.
questions.description: The to in used to is a preposition. Use an ing form after a preposition.

questions.question: Would you mind ……………………………. for a minute?
questions.description: Use an ing form after mind.

questions.question: That resort ………………………………… be a palace.
questions.description: Used to can indicate past states. Would cannot be used to express this idea.

questions.question: I still remember ………………….. her for the first time.
questions.description: When the reference is to past time, use an ing form after remember.

questions.question: I would rather you ………………………….. me alone.
questions.description: Use a past verb after would rather to refer to the present.

questions.question: It is high time you ……………………………. a job.
questions.description: Use a past tense after high time to refer to the present.

questions.question: I forgot …………………… him on his birthday.
I asked her ………………………………. she was interested.
questions.description: Either if or whether can be used to introduce an Yes/No question.

questions.question: Let him ................................ if he wants to.
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I am ……………………………….. a call from my brother.
questions.description: It should be I am expecting a call from my brother or I am waiting for a call from my brother.

questions.question: My grandfather ........................... at
questions.description: The simple past is used to talk about a finished event.

questions.question: The doctors said that he was ................................ on arrival.
questions.description: Dead on arrival is the correct expression.

questions.question: If she left home at six, she .............................. be here soon.
questions.description: We use should to express logical possibility.

questions.question: Whenever we meet, we ............................. politics.
questions.description: Discuss is one of those verbs that does not take a preposition.

questions.question: Have you ................................ for this drink?
questions.description: Paid is the past and past participle form of pay.

questions.question: He .............................. me a visit the other day.
questions.description: To pay a visit is to visit someone. Paid is the past form of pay.

questions.question: It took them hours to ............................ the fire in the basement.
questions.description: To put out fire is to extinguish it.

questions.question: What a brilliant idea ................................!
questions.description: In exclamatory sentences, the subject goes before the auxiliary verb.

questions.question: Tell me where .............................. all this while.
questions.description: In reported questions the inverted word order is used.

questions.question: You ……………………… give me my money back.
questions.description: Had better is used to give strong advice.

questions.question: She worked hard so that she ............................. the promotion.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, would, could or might are common in the clause introduced by so that.

questions.question: That child of ................................ has broken my window again.
You will not be able to join the course ……………………… you make the payment in advance.
questions.description: Unless means if not.

questions.question: We have lived in this town …………………………….. ten years.
questions.description: Use for with duration.

questions.question: He was accused ………………………… stealing the money.
questions.description: Accused is followed by of.

questions.question: I ………………………….. the exam yesterday.
questions.description: Use the simple past when we say when something happened.

questions.question: She …………………….. in
questions.description: Use the simple past when we say when something happened.

questions.question: The teacher along with the students ………………………….. gone on a field trip.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with along with, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: When ……………………………… your work yesterday?
questions.description: In questions we use the inverted word order - that means the auxiliary goes before the subject.

questions.question: He ……………………………… for more than a week.
One of the students ……………………………….. not submitted their work.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after one of.

questions.question: I ……………………………… for you since 9 o’clock in the morning.
questions.description: To talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present, use the present perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: I will talk to him when he …………………………….
questions.description: When both clauses refer to the future, use the simple present in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: My handwriting is better than ………………………………
questions.description: Here yours means your handwriting.

questions.question: What you said ……………………… unpardonable.
questions.description: Here the subject is the noun clause 'what you said'. When the subject is a clause, the verb is usually singular.

questions.question: They spoke in a low voice lest they ………………………. wake up the baby.
questions.description: Should is the only auxiliary that can be used after lest.

questions.question: I have invited them ……………………. dinner.
If you had called her, she ……………………… happy.
questions.description: In the third conditional, use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: Which of the following words does not have a plural form?
Smoking is injurious to health. Here smoking is a ………………….
questions.description: Ing forms used as the subject of a clause is a gerund.

questions.question: There is a cottage ……………………… the river.
questions.description: Above is preferred when one thing is not directly over another.

questions.question: Nobody came, ……………………?
questions.description: Affirmative tags are used after negative expressions like nobody. In question tags, use they to refer to nobody, somebody, anybody.

questions.question: Neither fish nor meat …………………….. with me.
questions.description: When you connect two singular subjects with neither/nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: To ruffle feathers is to ………………….
Call them at once. Change into passive.
questions.description: We use let to change imperatives into passive.
answers: Let them be called at once.
They should be called at once.

questions.question: My sister …………………….. abroad.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about permanent living arrangements.
